items.sentence: Some people think French is really hard to learn.
Tom doesn\'t want the same thing to happen again.
Tom doesn\'t want to study French, but he has to.
Tom doesn\'t wear pajamas. He sleeps in the nude.
Tom eats breakfast every morning at six o\'clock.
Tom fed the neighbor\'s cat while they were away.
Tom and Mary are always contradicting each other.
Tom and Mary are both still high school students.
Tom and Mary are expecting visitors this evening.
Tom got Mary to translate the letter into French.
Tom had never been in that part of Boston before.
Tom had no idea what the woman was talking about.
Tom had no reason to suspect that Mary was lying.
Tom had no way of knowing that this would happen.
I want to buy the same car that Tom wants to buy.
I want you to leave my house and never come back.
I want you to wear that new hat I bought for you.
The customers have been complaining a lot lately.
The doctor told Tom that his hair will grow back.
Was Tom the one who told you who to give that to?
Do you think it\'s safe for me to go outside now?
There\'s enough space at this table for everyone.
Things like this aren\'t supposed to happen here.
Tom and Mary will look after you while I\'m gone.
Tom arrived too early and Mary wasn\'t ready yet.
It would\'ve been better if we hadn\'t done that.
Tom doesn\'t feel like eating anything right now.
Tom doesn\'t have the will power to quit smoking.
Tom doesn\'t have to hide his feelings from Mary.
Your car is parked too close to the fire hydrant.
I had to leave the room because it was too smoky.
I have no will power when it comes to exercising.
I have proof that Tom is the one who killed Mary.
These are just routine questions we ask everyone.
These problems will be solved in the near future.
They are used to the humid climate of the summer.
Do you intend to eat that whole cake by yourself?
Do you really hide your money under the mattress?
Do you really think this is worth thirty dollars?
Do you want to spend the rest of your life alone?
Everybody is supposed to wear a tie at the party.
Tom threw a rock at Mary, but it didn\'t hit her.
Tom told Mary he wouldn\'t let her go by herself.
I don\'t know whether you\'d remember Tom or not.
I should\'ve been paying more attention in class.
I\'m afraid I\'ll be stuck in this place forever.
I\'m not a teacher and don\'t want to become one.
Tom and his friends rode their bikes to the pool.
Tom asked for permission to use the copy machine.
Tom asks me the same thing every time he sees me.
